intro: Trigonobalanus doichangensis, commonly known as the Doichang hill teak, is a rare and endemic tree species native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical forests and exhibits a slow growth rate, making it highly susceptible to deforestation. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
